faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.q1: How do I create an account?
faq.a1: Click Sign up, fill in the form, verify your email, then log in.
faq.a2: Check your spam. Otherwise, on the verification page, click ‚ÄúNot received?‚Äù to resend one.
faq.a3: On the Login page, click "Forgot password?", enter your email and you'll receive a reset link.
faq.q4: Where do I see my progress?
faq.a4: On the Dashboard: charts, accuracy by category and recent activity.
faq.q5: How do I choose the difficulty?
faq.a5: When choosing an exercise: Padawan (easy), Jedi (medium), Master (hard).
faq.a6: No. The goal is to practice and progress, not to be graded.
faq.a7: Settings or Alt+F: enable Focus mode (TSA/ADHD) or reduce motion (Alt+M).
faq.a9: Yes, partially: install Mathakine as an app (PWA) from your browser to use it offline.
faq.q10: An exercise or challenge seems incorrect?
faq.a10: Use the report button (red flag) at the bottom right to let us know. Your feedback helps us improve Mathakine.

about.title: About Mathakine
about.subtitle: A platform born from a family story

what.title: What is Mathakine?
what.intro: Mathakine is a mathematics learning platform designed for children and teenagers (ages 5 to 20).
what.desc: The goal is to allow everyone to progress at their own pace, without pressure or grades. The focus is on support, accessibility, and celebrating progress.
what.bullet1: Adapted exercises (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) and varied logic challenges
what.bullet2: Dashboard and badges to track progress
what.bullet3: Accessibility options (contrast, text, animations, Focus TSA/ADHD mode)

origin.title: Where does Mathakine come from?
origin.intro: A personal story that became a project.
origin.p1: Mathakine was born from a very concrete need: helping my son, Anakyn, prepare for a math competition with a simple, effective, and motivating tool.
origin.p2: Since he has specific needs, I was looking for content truly adapted to his way of learning. I found no solution that combined mathematics, logic challenges, accessibility, and a fun approach.
origin.p3: Being from the tech field and passionate about artificial intelligence, I decided to build this tool myself.
origin.p4: By sharing it around me, I quickly saw that it also answered the needs of other children, parents, and teachers. The project grew, with a simple idea: offer as many people as possible a more accessible, more engaging math platform‚Äîand always fun.
origin.tagline: That's the Mathakine spirit: learning seriously, without losing the fun.

who.title: Who is behind Mathakine?
who.desc: Created by Zyclope, Anakyn's dad. No partners or funders ‚Äî just the will to offer a useful and accessible tool to as many people as possible.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: How Mathakine handles your personal data

controller.title: Data controller
controller.desc: In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
controller.text: The data controller is Yannick Malgorn. For any questions regarding your personal data: webmaster@mathakine.fun

data.title: Data collected and purposes
data.intro: Mathakine collects only the data necessary for the service to operate.

account.title: User account
account.desc: Username, email address, password (hashed). Purpose: account creation, authentication, password recovery.

progress.title: Progress and activity
progress.desc: Exercise results, attempts, completed challenges, badges earned. Purpose: progress tracking, recommendation personalization, dashboard.

feedback.title: Reports
feedback.desc: Report messages (incorrect exercise, bug) with relevant page. Purpose: improving content and interface.

technical.title: Technical data
technical.desc: Technical logs, session identifiers, error traces (Sentry). Purpose: service operation, incident diagnostics.

retention.title: Retention period
retention.intro: Data is retained for the following periods, in line with the GDPR minimization principle.
retention.account: Account: until deletion by the user or erasure request.
retention.progress: Progress and activity: same duration as the account. Deleted when the account is deleted.
retention.feedback: Reports: 2 years after closure (or account deletion if associated).

rights.title: Your rights
rights.intro: You have the following rights regarding your data:
rights.access: Right of access: obtain a copy of your data.
rights.rectification: Right to rectification: correct inaccurate data.
rights.erasure: Right to erasure: request deletion of your data.
rights.portability: Right to portability: receive your data in a structured format.
rights.objection: Right to object: object to certain processing.
rights.complaint: Right to lodge a complaint: contact your data protection authority if you believe the processing is non-compliant.

subcontractors.title: Subcontractors
subcontractors.intro: Certain service providers process data on behalf of Mathakine.
subcontractors.note: Each subcontractor is contractually bound to comply with the GDPR. Standard policies, not negotiated.
subcontractors.render: Render: application and database hosting (USA, standard contractual clauses).
subcontractors.sentry: Sentry: error monitoring and technical diagnostics (minimal traces).
subcontractors.email: SendGrid or SMTP: sending verification and password reset emails.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.intro: Mathakine uses strictly necessary cookies for the service to function.
cookies.essential: Authentication cookies (access_token, refresh_token): maintaining the logged-in session. CSRF cookie: protection against cross-site attacks. These cookies are essential; refusing them prevents use of the service.
cookies.noMarketing: No advertising cookies or third-party trackers.
